pt.runtime

Class TaskpoolFIFOWorkSharing

  • java.lang.Object
    • pt.runtime.AbstractTaskPool
      • pt.runtime.TaskpoolFIFOWorkSharing
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Taskpool

    public class TaskpoolFIFOWorkSharing
extends AbstractTaskPool
    This class extends AbstractTaskPool which is an implementation of TaskPool and uses Work Sharing policy for scheduling tasks. In Work Sharing all tasks are queued to a shared global queue, and are executed by threads in a FIFO (first in first out) policy.
    Since:
    9/9/2014
    Author:
    Mostafa Mehrabi

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void enqueueReadyTask(TaskID<?> taskID)
      Enqueues a task that is ready to be executed to one of the following task pools.
      1- If the task can be executed by any thread, and is multi-task, it is enqueued to the globalMultiTask task pool.
      2- If the task can be executed by any thread, but is not multi-task it is enqueued to the globalOneOffTask task pool.
      3- If the task cannot be executed by any thread, it is enqueued to the local privateQueue of the thread in charge of executing the task.
      boolean executeSynchronously(int cutoff) 
      protected void initialise()
      (schedule-specific) Performs initialization depending on the scheduling policy.
      TaskID<?> workerPollNextTask()
      This method is called by a worker thread in order to get another task to execute.

      • enqueueReadyTask

        protected void enqueueReadyTask(TaskID<?> taskID)
        Enqueues a task that is ready to be executed to one of the following task pools.
        1- If the task can be executed by any thread, and is multi-task, it is enqueued to the globalMultiTask task pool.
        2- If the task can be executed by any thread, but is not multi-task it is enqueued to the globalOneOffTask task pool.
        3- If the task cannot be executed by any thread, it is enqueued to the local privateQueue of the thread in charge of executing the task.
        Specified by:
        enqueueReadyTask in class AbstractTaskPool
        Since:
        9/9/2014

      • workerPollNextTask

        public TaskID<?> workerPollNextTask()
        This method is called by a worker thread in order to get another task to execute. This method is schedule specific and its implementations are different for different scheduling types. For work sharing, the method tries to poll a task from the worker thread's privateQueue. If the polling is successful, it attempts to execute the task. If the attempt is successful the task will be passed to the worker thread to execute; otherwise this method will call for enqueueing the slots of that task, becuase unsuccessful execution attempts mean that the task is either cancelled or completed.

        If there are no tasks found in the thread's private queue, the method will then check the globalMultiTask queue, this is because one off tasks are not enqueued to private queues, and they are submitted to gloabOneOffTask queues from the beginning.
        While there are multi-tasks in the globalMultiTask queue, they are polled and expanded and enqueued as ready-to-execute tasks.
        If no tasks were found in the gloablMultiTask queue, the method will check the globalOneOffTask queue, and if still nothing is found, it will return null. It should be mentioned that polling is used to fetch the elements inserted earlier to fulfill the FIFO scheduling policy.
        Specified by:
        workerPollNextTask in interface Taskpool
        Specified by:
        workerPollNextTask in class AbstractTaskPool
        Returns:
        The TaskID appropriate for the current worker, otherwise null if there wasn't one at this time
        Since:
        9/9/2014
